Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Gearingmom
Reviews.Content: Our room was recently redecorated. Very clean and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Might be ok if you are not planning to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Ythnn
Reviews.Content: Noisy and uncomfortable rooms. Literally on a freeway that roars all night. Ambivalent staff. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent Hilton”
Reviews.Author: BluesTravelerVirgina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business trips and the hotel is excellent for business trips. Staff is excellent and really helpful. VERY clean hotel. Best choice in San Diego; especially a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel being upgraded!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy T
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for the past 5 years - it has been my home away from home. The staff has always been great! The exercise room is great for this sized hotel. The past month they have started redoing the rooms - the new look is beautiful! The hotel rooms look fresh again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff, Quiet Neighborhood Location”
Reviews.Author: DrFrisbie
Reviews.Content: Quietly beside a library and a Catholic church, this suburban hotel property has an exceptional staff, great food service team and well furnished rooms. We have stayed here a number of times and never been disappointed. Mike at the front desk is an accomplished professional. Housekeeping is attentive and responsive. "Souplantation" restaurant (fresh salad buffet) is an easy walk, as is a Mongolian buffet restaurant. Quick and easy access to I-15 without feeling like you're in an urban jungle. Clean, refreshing outdoor pool and well-maintained fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a good choice in the San Diego area”
Reviews.Author: JaapK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in this hotel. During our stay, the majority of guests seemed to be business(wo)men, although some families with children were present too. Overall, it is a quiet hotel (at least end of February), although the proximity of the interstate causes some background noise. The hotel offers a small outside pool, as well as a fitness center. The room was clean, the staff friendly. Breakfast was included in our deal, but at check-in, they forgot to hand us the breakfast coupons. Ofcourse, that mistake was corrected next morning. The front desk adviced us about the best route to go directly to downtown San Diego. It was a great pleasure to be pampered by Manny, the breakfast cook, who came to our table 20 minutes later to ask if the eggs, or pancakes, or wraps, or whatever, was okay, and the waiters (Sasha was one of our favorites) who every few minutes offered coffee or juice. For us, this hotel proved to be a perfect staring point for visits of San Diego, the Mission Trails Park, Ocean Beach. It is possible to have dinner in the hotel, and the quality is good, but it is served in the bar. Within walking distance there is a choice of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Location”
Reviews.Author: D S
Reviews.Content: We stood here for a quick weekend to look around San Diego. I am pretty picky about where we stay in fact I usually take a few days to find a hotel that we see all the reviews are good and make sure they say that the hotel is CLEAN! that is the most important of it all. I have to say that the Hilton Garden Inn San Diego Rancho Bernardo is "clean" the location is about 20 mins from the airport when we arrived the staff was friendly and offered us our choice of the three floors they have. We went with the first floor for easy access to the the outside parking but if you prefer they also offer underground parking. The lobby was nice and looked well kept. The room was a basic room with a flat screen TV a desk a sitting area and on King size bed which by the way was very comfortable. There is a knob on both sides of the bed that I have heard from some of the reviews that it is adjustable to make it firmer or softer if you need it. Ours may have been broken because it just kept twisting but it didn't matter the bed was great. Overall the room was very clean. There were no surprise fees at the end of our stay and it was really easy to check out with a feature that they offer on the room phone. We had a great stay and would stay here agian without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Timbernard
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week and was made to feel very welcome by all staff. A great value place for safe business accommodation with a comfortable bar, OK food but great service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but no Breakfast & High Fees”
Reviews.Author: hamrow
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel though perhaps a bit dated. No free breakfast and of course buying it there is not cheap. Like most places in California, local & state taxes bumped the bill up much higher than the basic rate. A plus though was free parking. I happened to arrive late in the evening and found that my TV was non-functional; even checked the power cord and power button on the side of the TV. I could have called the front desk but was ready for bed and didn't want to sit up waiting for a maintenance guy, so I just let them know on the way out the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in SG area”
Reviews.Author: orik13
Reviews.Content: I like Rancho Bernardo. So I looked for hotel in this specific area. The hotel was very good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was a family trip (2+2). All worked good for us and we really have nothing negative to specify (maybe mattresses were too soft for us - that's all).

Reviews.Title: “This place fit the bill.”
Reviews.Author: TonyPSP
Reviews.Content: For a last minute overnight inthe SD area...clean, well maintained rooms and got a deal on Priceline. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Go to Place in Rancho Bernardo”
Reviews.Author: Jollymon22
Reviews.Content: We have family in the area and typically stay here, primarily for it's location and value. The staff is always very accommodatiog and helpful. It is the ideal location near the center of Rancho Bernardo. We have been impressed with the considtency over many years. We should also note that it tends to be "Wedding Central" in RB. Virtually everytime we have visited on a weekend, there are wedding parties booked, so you might want to inquire.

Reviews.Title: “Solid performer!”
Reviews.Author: mchud
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business in a nearby location. Room pricing was excellent and with the included breakfast as a HH Gold - it was a real steal. Breakfast was better than average with cooked to order foods. Room was very comfortable with the beds having adjustments for softness. The workout room was well equipped, and machines felt well maintained. Pool was small, but a nice area to catch some rays. Only negative, depending on room location, it can be a very long walk to the lobby. Bottom line, great choice for price and comfort - negative a but of a schlepping into San Diego proper

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDiva51
Reviews.Content: We stayed there as a "launching point" to visit the San Diego zoo safari park, as this was a very reasonably-priced hotel just a few minutes' drive away. The hotel was your typical Hilton Garden Inn, it seemed like it was reasonably new or perhaps refurbished recently. The staff at the reception desk were exceptionally friendly and very helpful. The hotel seemed to have a lot of folks staying there on business, but was quiet even though it seemed to be pretty fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “a good place to stay if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: Jesena
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over the holiday weekend and hotels/motels near the downtown area were pretty expensive for what you got. Since we had our car with us anyway, we picked the well priced Hilton Garden Inn. They are approx. 30min from downtown (depending on where you want to go). We thought that this is a fair trade off, for a good hotel. The hotel itself is a bit hidden in an office area up a small hill. We had a room towards the highway in the back, but the windows were so good you could hardly hear a noise. The rooms were well appointed and clean and the mattress was comfortable. We just talked with the staff throughout check-in and check-out and they were nice and efficent. We would recommed the hotel for a stay in San Diego, but don't forget the car :-).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: IrishOne041
Reviews.Content: The Manager and staff were outstanding during the power outage! They made every effort to keep guests calm, informed and well taken care of. They had many guests who were obnoxious and blaming them for the outage but they stayed calm and collected and were just fantastic. No restaurants were open so they made the best of what they had on hand and fed us all. The team effort and managers leadership were what was needed in a crisis. Thanks to each and every one of these staff!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Enjoyable Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: rockhound94
Reviews.Content: After spending three hours moving 80 miles on I 5, this inn was a welcome relief. It's not easy to find, hiding behind an office building. The general area is upscale and there are a good many restaurants to choose from. The reception was quick and friendly. Our room was a good size with a balcony overlooking the pool. There was no furniture on any balconied rooms. Why have a balcony that one can not sit on? The work area was a good size and the wireless relatively fast. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was "spic and span". The water pressure was good and you got hot water fast. We were tired and decided to have just wine and crackers along with wine, in our room. There was enough room for two for dinner but maybe a little tight for three. This was a very enjoyable overnight in an eight week trip across the U.S. I would have given five circles if there had been furniture on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “For staying outside of San Diego, this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: writerguy1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from July 22-26 and had a great time. The hotel was very clean. My wife is a clean freak and she even commented on how clean it was. As for location it is about a 20 minute drive from downtown San Diego, and about 30 minutes from the Zoo and Sea World. It is a little tough to find when you exit the highway, its kind of tucked behind an office building and a hospital. It is in a great area with many places to eat and is in upscale neighborhood. If you don't want to stay downtown or can't afford to stay right on the ocean this is where I would stay. The hotel also does NOT charge for parking or have any incidental fees which is a real plus in my book. Also, they have a very nice pool that my daughter loved and a nice hot tub that I enjoyed. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Catbert10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in July. The hotel is very spread out, so there was a lot of walking between the elevators and my room. The rooms looked tired and the carpets needed a very deep cleaning. Breakfast in the morning was not that great. All buffet items were served by the kitchen staff, and the cooks made an awful omelet - the ingredients were piled inside rather than mixed with the egg. The belts on the treadmills were very loose, almost to the point of being unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay There Again, but NOT on the First Floor”
Reviews.Author: CampbellSheldon
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this HIlton Garden Inn and it was less comfortable than the first time we were there because we got a room on the first floor this time. The difference between the first floor and other floors is huge. The acoustics on the first floor are awful and in combination with all the extra foot traffic you will be in for a very noisy time of people yelling up and down the hallways at all hours of the day and doors that sound like vault doors closing when people enter and leave the hotel. On the positive side, the breakfast is really nice and we got a couple of free breakfast vouchers for each night of our stay. There aren't any really great breakfast spots around that part of town that we could find in our previous trips to San Diego so having a decent place for the morning meal right in the same building was a very welcome amenity. Aside from the noise, it was a comfortable stay and good value for the money, especially with the free breakfast for two. Parking is plentiful and you're in a convenient spot for freeway access to Downtown. It's anything but nightlife central there, but you're within a short distance of some decent restaurants and retail stores. I'd stay there again as long as we don't end up anywhere on the first floor, especially over a weekend when there might be wedding parties there or a special event happening in their conference rooms. In our previous stay on the second floor, it was a close to perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable business stay”
Reviews.Author: Enjoy_The_Views
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well placed, comfortable and perfect for a short business trip. They also help with short distance pickups and drops, which makes it very convenient if you need assistance. The breakfast is very fulfilling and makes you happy at the start of the day! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Solid mid-range business hotel, not especially kid-friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a two day Christmas stay near relatives. Checked in early but management didn't act particularly thrilled, especially when we had to modify one of the rooms due to unexpected add-ons of family staying with us. Hotel is very clean--the housekeeping and maintenance staff are on their game. Guest laundry is okay but needs better machines; it of course took two cycled to dry one load of clothes. Too cool to use the pool but appeared well maintained. Colocated to good shops and restaurants, which is nice considering the hotel has a limited menu. Only PBS & CN for kids cable channels, limited basic service otherwise. CRT TV, no DVD or game inputs. Overall a nice stay but wouild choose something with better amenities for extended visits to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrazyCatLady8791
Reviews.Content: Came down for a wedding the first weekend of November and stayed one night (we stayed the second night with family). The hotel was recommened as it was close to the wedding venue and affordable. It was a place to sleep, and that was fine, but the trip could've been better. The directions on the website stated to exit the I-15 at Rancho Bernardo Drive. We figured that you must be able to see the hotel from the freeway, which you can, if you're heading north, which we were not. Also, the hotel is not located on Rancho Bernardo Drive, but Bernardo Center Drive...did I mention that every street in this town has the word Bernardo in it? Good thing we had GPS in our phones. The Hilton is located in the same center as a spinal rehabilitation/hospital place, and some restaurants. After a nine hour drive, we just wanted to put our things down and get a late dinner...except the check in parking was blocked by Hilton shuttles, left unattended. We trudged up to check in, and the woman was nice, but not helpful. After telling us our room was located in "the middle of the hotel," she told us we could park "anywhere." Mind you, this hotel is in a complex with other businesses, so after being reminded of that, she suddenly remembered that Hilton parking was "that way," with a friendly point. These spots are very small and close together, so I would not park directly next to another car unless you must. After getting to our room, I realized we would need a late check out, as the wedding didn't start until three. When asked if we could have a late check out, the clerk answered, ".....ummmmmm....." and twirled her hair. I asked if we could leave at two, and she said, "Yeah, that could work. Two!" and that was that. No note on the computer, no reprogramming my key, nothing. The room itself was fine. The carpet was a bit stained, but the beds were clean and I slept fine. The walls were thin, but our neighbors were quiet (I actually feared that we may have bothered them, instead). Busy wedding morning, and we came back to our room to change. Except our key wouldn't let us back in the hotel. Because we had a late check out, but no one made a notation of it. Back to the front desk, where we asked for a new key. Didn't ask our names, didn't ask for ID, just reprogrammed the key. Finally, time to check out. But, alas, we had already checked out. At noon. Even though it was almost two o'clock, and we were still in our room. Wierd. Basically, this hotel sufficed for a place to rest my head for a night, but I wouldn't go back for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in average location”
Reviews.Author: tszabo
Reviews.Content: Liked: - Modern nice rooms - Free internet - Free parking Didn't like: - Noise from highway (request a room not facing it) and some heating/ventilation system noise noticeable - Breakfast not included ($10/person), at least when using HHonors rewards - About 30 minutes from San Diego (mostly highway)

Reviews.Title: “Everything you usually expect from an HGI, location a bit far from SD”
Reviews.Author: croelin1000
Reviews.Content: This Hilton Garden Inn is everything you'd usually expect from an HGI. The service, rooms, everything is good. No complaints there at all. The only warning I'd give other travelers is that it is a bit of a drive from downtown San Diego. If you're staying here for business in Rancho Bernardo, it's perfect. But if you're coming to be a tourist, it's 30 mins away from SD without traffic, so just plan to do the drive every day. The only main tourist attraction that's closer to this hotel is the San Diego Wild Animal Park (which is awesome, by the way, better than the actual Zoo in downtown SD).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel With Average Service”
Reviews.Author: samdavis05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to San Diego for our honeymoon... but let me tell you, we were not expecting a 5-star treatment. We came to San Diego to go to the Zoo and Sea World and to visit Old Town so we were just expecting a clean hotel with a pool, near Sea World and the Zoo with nice hotel service. So, this hotel is nice if you're not looking to be pampered or treated like a queen/king. We are from Canada and hadn't been to San Diego before but we brought our GPS with us - but still, we had a HARD time finding the hotel (really SMALL hotel sign). It's tucked in behind a surgery center and a few buffet restaurants. It was an asian man that checked us in and I'm not sure if he was rude or I was just expecting a little better service but he didn't greet us at all and rolled his eyes when we told him we parked in front of the hotel because we were waiting to ask where we had to park and if we had to pay for parking. Then when I told him it was our honeymoon he was didn't say anything - most people say 'congratulations' or something of the sort. It was a little disappointing traveling 3 days from Northern B.C. Canada all the way to San Diego, California, USA and having a bad experience with just checking in. The hotel is for the most part clean - a few things I noticed were; the pool needs to treated and cleaned for sure, the back of our hotel room door is covered in something sticky like someone spilled pop or something and didn't clean it off afterward, and lots of stains on the carpets. The hotel does have a restaurant in it - the first night we stayed we ordered dinner through room service and the food was SO good and the lady that dropped it off was a sweetheart. We had breakfast a few times there and again the food was amazing but the service was alright - the ladies seem to gossip or talk amongst themselves more then they talk to you. Basically, our overall experience of this hotel was average or 'alright' - we're not hard-to-please-people and weren't expecting a lot but the service wasn't so great. However, there were a few people, we noticed, that went out of their way to do a few things for us or help us with something we were unsure of. The location of the hotel is poor. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable and the balcony is nice. Also, just for people to be aware - this hotel is a tournament hotel... I read a review about that but thought we should be okay, there shouldn't be a team staying here the 4 days we are there BUT I think it was two soccer teams that stayed here and ran up and down the hallways during the day. So if you're looking for quiet during the day - I would say find a different place. We, however, were gone most of the day so it didn't bother us until the late evenings but they were quiet at night. Also, the first morning we were here, we noticed a newspaper that someone had slid underneath our door and we thought it was a sweet but turns out, you pay for it - they charge it to your credit card. I guess it says in FINE PRINT on your paper that comes with the door key. I would stay here again if I got better service the next time. A few things I recommend to people wanting to travel to San Diego and possibly stay at this hotel are rent a vehicle through ALAMO - their service was absolutely over-the-top. We paid in advance a small regular car and they upgraded us to a nicer one for nothing and the gentleman that helped us seemed genuine and honest and excited to see us. It was nice. Also, I HIGHLY recommend going out for a nice dinner at Carver's SteakHouse, it's just down the road from the hotel and it was the BEST service we have ever had ANYWHERE. Absolutely amazing. So much so that our waiter talked with us for a few mins and got to know us and when he found out it was our honeymoon - he ordered a dessert for us in the shape of a heart. So beautiful. And the food, oh my goodness... SO GOOOD. We asked our waiter if we could leave our rental car at the restaurant so we could have a few drinks and he said it wouldn't be a problem but when we were ready to go.. we would've had to wait over an hour for a taxi so he got his assistant to drive us back to our hotel. He was very sweet. This restaurant is truly amazing. Again, our overall experience with the hotel was average - nothing special which is disappointing because it is a chain hotel of the Hilton Hotels. There were a few people that really stood out to us in a good way and a few in a bad way. I would recommend this place to friends if they were looking for a place to just sleep and not have to interact with the people that work here too much.

Reviews.Title: “House hunting trip. Hotel was fine.”
Reviews.Author: CathRun
Reviews.Content: The breakfast buffet is worth the the money. It was a good start to the day and only $5 for kids. Much better than McDonald's as the buffet offers fresh fruit and egg selections. We use HGI frequently and find them reliable, clean and sophisticated. For business it is probably a good choice as the hotel is quiet and professional. However their business center consists of two computers and a stapler. I took my older daughter only on this house hunting trip but if I had travelled with all my kids I would have gone insane. There is nothing nearby for them to do and frankly the hotel isn't very kid friendly. I found the staff courteous but cool.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: tlctlb
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in advance and got a fantastic rate. When I got here, Marysol at the registration desk allowed me to upgrade my room at no additional cost (I didn't know when I booked it that I would be bringing the wife and kids on this business trip). The service here is fantastic. The housekeepers all say hello and good morning to you at every chance. The room was spacious and perfect. The fitness center has two elipticals and 2 treadmills and one stationery bike, as well as weights. The Wi-Fi is FREE! And complimentary USA Today. This location is just one minute off I-15 and close to Wild Animal Park (15 mins) and about half an hour from Legoland. Plus, there are a lot of great places to shop and eat in this quaint little town (Rancho Bernardo). Highly recommended for families!

Reviews.Title: “Tournament Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LJordon25
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as it was the host hotel for a tournament in the area. BUT it is the host hotel for numerous tournaments in the area so if you are looking for peace and quiet... good luck. Room was good, roomy, beds were too small, but the microwave and fridge in the room helped. Still, a little pricey compared to other equivalent hotels in the area. The only major complaint I would have was the customer service was really awful. The front desk staff did not make you feel welcome and it was like pulling teeth trying to get them to answer anything or do anything. Probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very NIce”
Reviews.Author: Cycleboy
Reviews.Content: I like Hilton Garden Inns in general, the services available for the price you pay are quite a bargain. The staff at this HGI was very nice, attentive and accomodating. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: VINEYBOY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on holiday during 2007 and it was an excellent hotel. I lik ethe hotel brand and have stayed at several in the States. This one was good with lovely friendly staff, a great pool, and in a nice area. It was a bit of a drive to the beaches, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in years - Hotel brand new!”
Reviews.Author: Gemma'smum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new Hilton Garden Inn on OceanAire in San Diego. Superb service. I am in hotels frequently with work throughout the U.S.and abroad. This hotel shocked me. Better service than I receive in a 5 star in a major city. Just great! Everyone answered questions and found answers. Service at every turn. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable but Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Triplewin
Reviews.Content: I wasn't disappointed by this HGI, but I wasn't wowed either. Certainly after reading some of the reviews the staff has the ability to touch some of their guests. My rooms was a suite and extremely large. There was a comfortable work station and wired internet only. The work station was at the opposite end of the very large suite, so there was no checking emails in bed. Room was equipped with a small fridge, microwave, coffee maker, 11/2 baths. The furniture in the living area was in good shape. The room and bathrooms were very clean. The bed was a disappointment for a HGI. Many of the Hilton properties have been upgrading their beds but not here. The bed was fine, but not what I was hoping for. There were a couple of other problems, the auto closing bathroom doors can be an annoyance until I figured out my shoe would stop it, the bathroom sink drain ran real slow. The room was located so I got great deal of noise from the freeway and it was not a peaceful rest. The morning breakfast staff was attentive and the food was very good. Overall, I would recommend this for business travelers, or people trying to escape downtown hotel rates.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Arjan_W
Reviews.Content: I don't really understand all the positive fuss about this hotel. Just another mainstream business hotel along the freeway. Service was so so. Area is safe. The hotel room is relatively small, the beds are not that comfy and the bathroom door does not remain open (quite annoying but due to safety reasons so they say). All and all not too shabby but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: torreswedding
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay for our weekend getaway and weren't looking to spend to much on the hotel. The hotel was near resturants,stores, gas stations etc. so the location was good. We had no problem with our room or the food at the hotel. Going to downtown San Diego took awhile but I enjoyed the different scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SPDG_MOM
Reviews.Content: I don't have a bad thing to say about this hotel. It is in a very nice area where we felt safe with our kids. There are many nearby places to eat. And the drive into town (we spent our time at Mission Beach and Seaworld) was not bad at all - we never ran into traffic during the four days we were there. The little bit of a drive is worth it for the extremely decent rates for such a nice hotel. Definitely worth it.. I am still trying to figure out what the underground parking is about, I parked near the front of the hotel the entire time and had no problem with parking. The area is beautiful and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: andersonclwj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a fancy hilton with valet or frills. Just a nice, clean, nicely decorated hotel with a fair price. Our room also had a microwave and refrigerator which we took full advatage of by going to the grocerey store 5 minutes away. The breakfast was better than any other complimentry breakfast we have had. Make yourself waffles, oatmeal, pastries, fruit, yogart, cereals. You can also at no extra charge, get made to order gourmet omelets with a variety of herbs, cheeses, meats and avacodo. I also saw other people ordering pancakes and bisuits and gravy with sausage and bacon. It was also nice that although you kind of serve yourself, there was a waitstaff providing you with coffee and hot chocolate with refills. Anyone with children like us can always appreciate a hotel like this. The only negative thing I have to say is the hotel is not romantic, which was fine since we had our two kids. And the hotel is far away from actual San Diego, which was fine since my husband had business north. We had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice; but.”
Reviews.Author: Rappongi27
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the end of July 2007, using 2 rooms for the 4 of us. This was the weekend of the annual Comic Con, so rooms were tight everywhere in the San Diego area. Both rooms were very comfortable and pleasant. We had no noise issues as reported by some reviewers, but then we were on the side away from the freeway. I agree with reviewers that it may not be the best choice if you are thinking of spending all your time downtown, but if you are going to be in Rancho Bernardo anyways (we were there for family) or to see the Wild Animal Park, it is a good choice. But; I downgraded the hotel, however, based upon a poor job of cleaning the toilet before we got there in one of the two rooms. Someone needs to remember to lift the seat up and clean the bottom of it, too. This is not an easily overlooked error, in my book. (Especially as it isn't cheap.)

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as everybody says it is. Far away from downtown SD”
Reviews.Author: sgtpet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly off I-15 and is a good 30-45 minutes away from downtown SD as well as Sea World and the Zoo. I had to spend several times in SD rush hour traffic. I went on vacation to avoid that type of traffic. This hotel is in the suburbs. The parking lot is tight and if you have your own car don't be suprised if it gets "dinged" If you want to be away from all the great things about San Diego stay at this hotel. Otherwise pick something closer to downtown. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisamarie3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for our 2nd anniversary. He had called ahead to see if they could arrange a nice room for us away from the freeway side, because of the other reviews we've read. He spoke to a very nice Front Desk Agent named Katrina, who was able to put aside a great room. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the very same Katrina, who was unbelieveably sweet. She actually upgraded us and arranged for Champagne and a Fruit & Cheese platter to be in the room! This entire place was beautifully set up, and extremely clean. We didn't hear ANY freeway noise at all, even with the windows open. It was an easy 20-minute trip to the downtown area, Balboa Park, and basically any other tourist attraction. This hotel really made our already great trip unbelieveable! I work for a 4-star hotel in New York City, and believe me, the service (and everything else for that matter) at the Hilton Garden Inn is wonderful. We will definitely stay here the next time we come to San Diego!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just "OK"”
Reviews.Author: sarah2000
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based upon reviews on this site. We were in San Diego for a week & needed a place for two nights before moving to Coronado for a business conference. Knew the Rancho Bernardo area as we had been several times before to visit family. We had a car & wanted to explore the coast on up to Laguna Beach. This location suited us for the short term. All that being said..... If you are coming to San Diego to tour San Diego I would not stay in this location. It is far from the tourist action as in Sea World, Old Town, Coronado, Balboa Park etc.... This hotel is better suited for the business traveler, large groups, or someone with reason to be in the Rancho Bernardo area. The hotel was a typical Hilton Garden Inn. The lobby was bright & attractive with several seating areas. The rooms were new & fresh. Nice size bathroom. Friendly staff The downside was the NOISE! Very loud place to be. The freeway noise was terrible. We could not see the freeway from our room as our room faced an apartment complex. Even with the buffer of another building the noise was horrible. In the past I have lived close to an airport as well as a freeway & the noise never bothered me. In this location the freeway noise was loud & constant to the point of bothersome. As far as restaurants, the hotel has their own restaurant. There are two chain restaurants in the same complex. Souplantation & Stir Fresh (a Mongolian Restaurant). We ate at Stir Fresh and enjoyed it. Overall we liked the Hilton Garden Inn. Our stay was fine with the exception of the freeway noise.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Garden Inn San Diego/Rancho Bernardo
HotelInfo.Address: 17240 Bernardo Center Drive, San Diego, CA 92128
